lines.value: Out on thee! Seeming! I will write against it:
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: You seem to me as Dian in her orb,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: As chaste as is the bud ere it be blown;
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: But you are more intemperate in your blood
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Than Venus, or those pamper'd animals
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: That rage in savage sensuality.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Is my lord well, that he doth speak so wide?
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Sweet prince, why speak not you?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: DON PEDRO
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: What should I speak?
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: I stand dishonour'd, that have gone about
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: To link my dear friend to a common stale.
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Are these things spoken, or do I but dream?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: DON JOHN
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Sir, they are spoken, and these things are true.
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: This looks not like a nuptial.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: True! O God!
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: CLAUDIO
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Leonato, stand I here?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Is this the prince? is this the prince's brother?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Is this face Hero's? are our eyes our own?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: All this is so: but what of this, my lord?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: CLAUDIO
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Let me but move one question to your daughter;
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: And, by that fatherly and kindly power
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: That you have in her, bid her answer truly.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: I charge thee do so, as thou art my child.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: O, God defend me! how am I beset!
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: What kind of catechising call you this?
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: CLAUDIO
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: To make you answer truly to your name.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Is it not Hero? Who can blot that name
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: With any just reproach?
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: CLAUDIO
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Marry, that can Hero;
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Hero itself can blot out Hero's virtue.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: What man was he talk'd with you yesternight
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Out at your window betwixt twelve and one?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Now, if you are a maid, answer to this.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: I talk'd with no man at that hour, my lord.
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: DON PEDRO
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Why, then are you no maiden. Leonato,
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: I am sorry you must hear: upon mine honour,
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Myself, my brother and this grieved count
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Did see her, hear her, at that hour last night
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Talk with a ruffian at her chamber-window
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Who hath indeed, most like a liberal villain,
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: Confess'd the vile encounters they have had
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: A thousand times in secret.
lines.speaker: DON PEDRO

lines.value: DON JOHN
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Fie, fie! they are not to be named, my lord,
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Not to be spoke of;
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: There is not chastity enough in language
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Without offence to utter them. Thus, pretty lady,
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: I am sorry for thy much misgovernment.
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: CLAUDIO
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: O Hero, what a Hero hadst thou been,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: If half thy outward graces had been placed
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: About thy thoughts and counsels of thy heart!
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: But fare thee well, most foul, most fair! farewell,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: Thou pure impiety and impious purity!
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: For thee I'll lock up all the gates of love,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: And on my eyelids shall conjecture hang,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: To turn all beauty into thoughts of harm,
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: And never shall it more be gracious.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIO

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Hath no man's dagger here a point for me?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Why, how now, cousin! wherefore sink you down?
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: DON JOHN
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Come, let us go. These things, come thus to light,
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: Smother her spirits up.
lines.speaker: DON JOHN

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: How doth the lady?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Dead, I think. Help, uncle!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Hero! why, Hero! Uncle! Signior Benedick! Friar!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: O Fate! take not away thy heavy hand.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Death is the fairest cover for her shame
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: That may be wish'd for.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: How now, cousin Hero!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Have comfort, lady.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Dost thou look up?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Yea, wherefore should she not?
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Wherefore! Why, doth not every earthly thing
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Cry shame upon her? Could she here deny
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: The story that is printed in her blood?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Do not live, Hero; do not ope thine eyes:
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: For, did I think thou wouldst not quickly die,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Thought I thy spirits were stronger than thy shames,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Myself would, on the rearward of reproaches,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Strike at thy life. Grieved I, I had but one?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Chid I for that at frugal nature's frame?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: O, one too much by thee! Why had I one?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Why ever wast thou lovely in my eyes?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Why had I not with charitable hand
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Took up a beggar's issue at my gates,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Who smirch'd thus and mired with infamy,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: I might have said 'No part of it is mine;
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: This shame derives itself from unknown loins'?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: But mine and mine I loved and mine I praised
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: And mine that I was proud on, mine so much
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: That I myself was to myself not mine,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Valuing of her,--why, she, O, she is fallen
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Into a pit of ink, that the wide sea
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Hath drops too few to wash her clean again
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: And salt too little which may season give
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: To her foul-tainted flesh!
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Sir, sir, be patient.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: For my part, I am so attired in wonder,
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I know not what to say.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: O, on my soul, my cousin is belied!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Lady, were you her bedfellow last night?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: No, truly not; although, until last night,
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: I have this twelvemonth been her bedfellow.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Confirm'd, confirm'd! O, that is stronger made
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Which was before barr'd up with ribs of iron!
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Would the two princes lie, and Claudio lie,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Who loved her so, that, speaking of her foulness,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Wash'd it with tears? Hence from her! let her die.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Hear me a little;
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: For I have only been silent so long
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And given way unto this course of fortune.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: By noting of the lady I have mark'd
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: A thousand blushing apparitions
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: To start into her face, a thousand innocent shames
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: In angel whiteness beat away those blushes;
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And in her eye there hath appear'd a fire,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: To burn the errors that these princes hold
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Against her maiden truth. Call me a fool;
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Trust not my reading nor my observations,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Which with experimental seal doth warrant
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: The tenor of my book; trust not my age,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: My reverence, calling, nor divinity,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: If this sweet lady lie not guiltless here
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Under some biting error.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Friar, it cannot be.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Thou seest that all the grace that she hath left
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Is that she will not add to her damnation
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: A sin of perjury; she not denies it:
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Why seek'st thou then to cover with excuse
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: That which appears in proper nakedness?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Lady, what man is he you are accused of?
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: HERO
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: They know that do accuse me; I know none:
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: If I know more of any man alive
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Than that which maiden modesty doth warrant,
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Let all my sins lack mercy! O my father,
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Prove you that any man with me conversed
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: At hours unmeet, or that I yesternight
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Maintain'd the change of words with any creature,
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: Refuse me, hate me, torture me to death!
lines.speaker: HERO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: There is some strange misprision in the princes.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Two of them have the very bent of honour;
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: And if their wisdoms be misled in this,
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: The practise of it lives in John the bastard,
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Whose spirits toil in frame of villanies.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: I know not. If they speak but truth of her,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: These hands shall tear her; if they wrong her honour,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: The proudest of them shall well hear of it.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Time hath not yet so dried this blood of mine,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Nor age so eat up my invention,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Nor fortune made such havoc of my means,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Nor my bad life reft me so much of friends,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: But they shall find, awaked in such a kind,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Both strength of limb and policy of mind,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Ability in means and choice of friends,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: To quit me of them throughly.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Pause awhile,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And let my counsel sway you in this case.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Your daughter here the princes left for dead:
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Let her awhile be secretly kept in,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And publish it that she is dead indeed;
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Maintain a mourning ostentation
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And on your family's old monument
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Hang mournful epitaphs and do all rites
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: That appertain unto a burial.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: What shall become of this? what will this do?
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Marry, this well carried shall on her behalf
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Change slander to remorse; that is some good:
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: But not for that dream I on this strange course,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: But on this travail look for greater birth.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: She dying, as it must so be maintain'd,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Upon the instant that she was accused,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Shall be lamented, pitied and excused
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Of every hearer: for it so falls out
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: That what we have we prize not to the worth
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Whiles we enjoy it, but being lack'd and lost,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Why, then we rack the value, then we find
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: The virtue that possession would not show us
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Whiles it was ours. So will it fare with Claudio:
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: When he shall hear she died upon his words,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: The idea of her life shall sweetly creep
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Into his study of imagination,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And every lovely organ of her life
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Shall come apparell'd in more precious habit,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: More moving-delicate and full of life,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Into the eye and prospect of his soul,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Than when she lived indeed; then shall he mourn,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: If ever love had interest in his liver,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And wish he had not so accused her,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: No, though he thought his accusation true.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Let this be so, and doubt not but success
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Will fashion the event in better shape
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Than I can lay it down in likelihood.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: But if all aim but this be levell'd false,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: The supposition of the lady's death
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Will quench the wonder of her infamy:
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: And if it sort not well, you may conceal her,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: As best befits her wounded reputation,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: In some reclusive and religious life,
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Out of all eyes, tongues, minds and injuries.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Signior Leonato, let the friar advise you:
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: And though you know my inwardness and love
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Is very much unto the prince and Claudio,
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Yet, by mine honour, I will deal in this
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: As secretly and justly as your soul
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Should with your body.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: LEONATO
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Being that I flow in grief,
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: The smallest twine may lead me.
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: FRIAR FRANCIS
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: 'Tis well consented: presently away;
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: For to strange sores strangely they strain the cure.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Come, lady, die to live: this wedding-day
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: Perhaps is but prolong'd: have patience and endure.
lines.speaker: FRIAR FRANCIS

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Lady Beatrice, have you wept all this while?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Yea, and I will weep a while longer.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I will not desire that.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: You have no reason; I do it freely.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Surely I do believe your fair cousin is wronged.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Ah, how much might the man deserve of me that would right her!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Is there any way to show such friendship?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: A very even way, but no such friend.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: May a man do it?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: It is a man's office, but not yours.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I do love nothing in the world so well as you: is
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: not that strange?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: As strange as the thing I know not. It were as
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: possible for me to say I loved nothing so well as
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: you: but believe me not; and yet I lie not; I
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: confess nothing, nor I deny nothing. I am sorry for my cousin.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: By my sword, Beatrice, thou lovest me.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Do not swear, and eat it.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I will swear by it that you love me; and I will make
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: him eat it that says I love not you.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Will you not eat your word?
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: With no sauce that can be devised to it. I protest
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I love thee.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Why, then, God forgive me!
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: What offence, sweet Beatrice?
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: You have stayed me in a happy hour: I was about to
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: protest I loved you.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: And do it with all thy heart.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: I love you with so much of my heart that none is
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: left to protest.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Come, bid me do any thing for thee.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Kill Claudio.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Ha! not for the wide world.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: You kill me to deny it. Farewell.
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK

lines.value: Beat--
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: Princes and counties! Surely, a princely testimony,
lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK

lines.value: BEATRICE

lines.speaker: BEATRICE

lines.value: BENEDICK

lines.value: As water in a sieve: give not me counsel;
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.value: Charm ache with air and agony with words:
lines.speaker: LEONATO

lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: First, of my word; therefore play, music. Prince,
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: thou art sad; get thee a wife, get thee a wife:
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: there is no staff more reverend than one tipped with horn.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: My lord, your brother John is ta'en in flight,
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: And brought with armed men back to Messina.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: BENEDICK
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Think not on him till to-morrow:
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: I'll devise thee brave punishments for him.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK

lines.value: Strike up, pipers.
lines.speaker: BENEDICK
